channel.title: Ask a Jew
channel.description:
The last piece to the puzzle. I haven't seen this thread yet.
Keep in mind of my background: I am being raised as a Jew. I went to synagogue, K-12 (am currently in 9th) in a Jewish school, etc. etc. By faith, I consider myself agnostic (don't call me atheist, agnostic vs. atheist is a debate I already took part in a different thread). As in, I just refuse to make up my mind whether god exists or not. He easily could, but then again he might not.
So that means that I can answer your questions thoroughly while being impartial to the matter.
Ask away if you must.

item.title: Ask a Jew
item.dc:creator: baconeggs
item.description:
Brought over from the Christian thread:

I noticed that a lot of laws laid down by god have death penalties for breaking them. Why don’t Jews follow through with these punishments?

Read full topic

item.title: Ask a Jew
item.dc:creator: Note-anator
item.description:
(Some would suffer worse than others I suppose… Still)

Yup… the worst of it, is he suffered horrible from muscle twitches, and myopic issues as well

But that may have been a bit fake out, because I heard that he worked at a sex change clinic previous… Gotta pay the bills some hoe I suppose.

Read full topic

It is, apparently…

I dont know a single woman that prefers vanilla. Everyone I know that I have ever gotten to that conversation have all stated they cannot fathom ever being with a guy that is not circumsized.

Did your husband had a zipper malfunction or something?

Ok, Thanks for the PM invite, I may well have some more questions - thats for that

item.title: Ask a Jew
item.dc:creator: baconeggs
item.description:
What’s up with German? It’s sounds like you’ve got something in your throat. And what about scottish? Are your balls touching the floor or something? And don’t get me started on English, so many useless fucking words…

You can’t really question WHY an language sounds like something, idiot.

mattemuse:

Are you sure that you know what “facetious” means?

I’d say he does.

Read full topic

item.title: Ask a Jew
item.dc:creator: Note-anator
item.description:
I have to agree really. The sad part of it, is that some chose/are tainted by/inherit a bias against religion in general, and only tend to be able to see either the nutters that cause issues, or the things that are harsh to our veiw, but ignore the intent. Their choice. And of course, that is a two way street. There are those that choose to ignore science, or what psychology has to say, in favour of the mystical never seeming to understand there is a difference. I am rather lucky because having come from a religious backround, and then learning to understand the science veiw of things, i have come to appreciate the beauty in nature from both side.

What are your thoughts on teh book of Ruth? Romance old school style?

I love Proverbs… How about you? What passages do you like?

Read full topic

item.title: Ask a Jew
item.dc:creator: russilker
item.description:
Exactly. IMO if one good thing comes out of religion, its that it develops people’s abilities to look at a subject different ways.

Religion is… facetious. Thats for sure.

Read full topic
